snp2.1:1.2: on the ground or in the sky:
snp2.1:1.3: may beings all be of happy heart,
snp2.1:1.4: and listen carefully to what is said.
snp2.1:2.1: So pay heed, all you beings,
snp2.1:2.3: who day and night bring offerings;
snp2.1:3.1: There’s no wealth in this life or the next,
snp2.1:3.2: no sublime gem in the heavens,
snp2.1:3.4: This sublime gem is in the Buddha:
snp2.1:3.5: by this truth, may you be well!
snp2.1:4.1: Ending, dispassion, the undying, the sublime,
snp2.1:4.2: attained by the Sakyan Sage immersed in samādhi;
snp2.1:4.3: there is nothing equal to that Dhamma.
snp2.1:4.4: This sublime gem is in the Dhamma:
snp2.1:4.5: by this truth, may you be well!
snp2.1:5.1: The purity praised by the highest Buddha
snp2.1:5.2: is said to be the “immersion with immediate fruit”;
snp2.1:5.3: no equal to that immersion is found.
snp2.1:5.4: This sublime gem is in the Dhamma:
snp2.1:5.5: by this truth, may you be well!
snp2.1:6.1: The eight individual persons praised by the good
snp2.1:6.2: are the four pairs of the Holy One’s disciples;
snp2.1:6.3: they are worthy of religious donations,
snp2.1:6.4: what’s given to them is very fruitful.
snp2.1:6.5: This sublime gem is in the Saṅgha:
snp2.1:6.6: by this truth, may you be well!
snp2.1:7.3: they’ve attained the goal, <j>plunged into freedom from death,
snp2.1:7.4: and enjoy the quenching they’ve freely gained.
snp2.1:7.5: This sublime gem is in the Saṅgha:
snp2.1:7.6: by this truth, may you be well!
snp2.1:8.1: As Indra’s pillar rooted in earth
snp2.1:8.2: is not shaken by the four winds,
snp2.1:8.3: I say a true person is like this,
snp2.1:8.4: who sees the noble truths in experience.
snp2.1:8.5: This sublime gem is in the Saṅgha:
snp2.1:8.6: by this truth, may you be well!
snp2.1:9.1: Those who fathom the noble truths
snp2.1:9.2: taught by the one of deep wisdom,
snp2.1:9.3: do not take an eighth life,
snp2.1:9.4: even if they are hugely negligent.
snp2.1:9.5: This sublime gem is in the Saṅgha:
snp2.1:9.6: by this truth, may you be well!
snp2.1:11.1: They’re freed from the four places of loss,
snp2.1:11.3: This sublime gem is in the Saṅgha:
snp2.1:11.4: by this truth, may you be well!
snp2.1:12.1: Even if they do a bad deed
snp2.1:12.3: they are unable to conceal it;
snp2.1:12.4: this inability applies to <j>one who has seen the truth, they say.
snp2.1:12.5: This sublime gem is in the Saṅgha:
snp2.1:12.6: by this truth, may you be well!
snp2.1:13.1: Like a tall forest tree crowned with flowers
snp2.1:13.2: in the first month of summer;
snp2.1:13.3: that’s how he taught the superb Dhamma,
snp2.1:13.4: leading to extinguishment, the ultimate benefit.
snp2.1:13.5: This sublime gem is in the Buddha:
snp2.1:13.6: by this truth, may you be well!
snp2.1:14.1: The superb, knower of the superb, <j>giver of the superb, bringer of the superb;
snp2.1:14.3: This sublime gem is in the Buddha:
snp2.1:14.4: by this truth, may you be well!
snp2.1:15.1: The old is ended, nothing new is produced.
snp2.1:15.2: their minds have no desire for future rebirth.
snp2.1:15.3: Withered are the seeds, there’s no desire for growth,
snp2.1:15.4: those attentive ones are extinguished like this lamp.
snp2.1:15.5: This sublime gem is in the Saṅgha:
snp2.1:15.6: by this truth, may you be well!
snp2.1:16.2: on the ground or in the sky:
snp2.1:16.3: the Realized One is honored by gods and humans!
snp2.1:16.4: We bow to the Buddha! May you be safe!
snp2.1:17.2: on the ground or in the sky:
snp2.1:17.3: the Realized One is honored by gods and humans!
snp2.1:17.4: We bow to the Dhamma! May you be safe!
snp2.1:18.2: on the ground or in the sky:
snp2.1:18.3: the Realized One is honored by gods and humans!
snp2.1:18.4: We bow to the Saṅgha! May you be safe!
